comment.text: The translation key "PortalName" is used to display a portal name in a user interface. It typically appears as a label on a configuration input field in the "Create Portal Dialog". Its purpose is to provide a human-readable representation of the portal's identifier for validation and accessibility.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The German translation lacks a space after the productName placeholder, which can make it harder to read and integrate into the application.

The translation 'Meno {{productName}}' is a literal translation of '{{productName}} name'. A more natural Slovak translation would be 'Názov produktu {{productName}}' or 'Produkt {{productName}}'. 'Meno' typically refers to a person's name, not a product's name.

The English content '{{productName}} name' implies a possessive or descriptive relationship. The Slovenian translation 'Ime {{productName}}' simply translates to 'Name {{productName}}', which is less idiomatic. A more accurate translation would incorporate a possessive or descriptive element.

The Serbian (Cyrillic) translation '{{productName}} име' is not an accurate translation of '{{productName}} name'. 'Име' translates to 'name' but doesn't convey the intended meaning which implies a specific portal's name. A more accurate translation would be 'Назив {{productName}}' or 'Назив портала {{productName}}'.

The translation 'Ім’я простору {{productName}}' is not an accurate translation of '{{productName}} name'. 'Простору' implies 'space', which doesn't directly translate the meaning of 'name' in this context. A more accurate translation would be 'Назва {{productName}}' or '{{productName}}: назва'.
